intro: Erlangea imatongensis, commonly known as the Imatong mistplant, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South Sudan. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its delicate, woolly leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an important subject for botanical research.
